src.video_control package¶

Submodules¶

src.video_control.camera_source module¶

class src.video_control.camera_source.CameraSource[source]¶

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class representing a camera source.

This class defines the interface that all concrete camera sources must implement. A camera source is responsible for initialization, providing frames, and proper shutdown.

abstract get_frames() → Tuple[int, Any | None][source]¶

Retrieve the next frame(s) from the camera source.

Returns:

A tuple containing: - An integer timestamp or frame index. - The frame data, which can be in any format depending on the implementation

(e.g., NumPy array, OpenCV frame, etc.). Returns None if no frame is available.

Return type:

Tuple[int, Optional[Any]]

Notes

Implementations may block until a new frame is available, or return None if no frame is ready.

abstract initialize() → None[source]¶

Initialize the camera source.

This method should set up any resources required for capturing frames, such as opening camera devices, starting streams, or allocating buffers.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the camera cannot be initialized.

abstract shutdown() → None[source]¶

Shut down the camera source and release any resources.

This method should safely close camera devices, stop streams, and clean up allocated resources.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the camera cannot be properly shut down.

src.video_control.streamer module¶

class src.video_control.streamer.OpenCVStreamTrack(frame_queue)[source]¶

Bases: VideoStreamTrack

async recv()[source]¶

Receive the next VideoFrame.

The base implementation just reads a 640x480 green frame at 30fps, subclass VideoStreamTrack to provide a useful implementation.
